synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The crystal undergoes complete exchange of protium for deuterium on both mobile and immobile water molecules when exposed to D2O vapor.

synthesis_conditions.preparation_method: Placing crystals of 2 in a desiccator for 36 hours
synthesis_conditions.result: Three formula units of H2O are removed, leading to a stoichiometry change and reduction of free water sites.

synthesis_conditions.preparation_method: Exposing 2.1 to a humid atmosphere, e.g., enclosing a crystal in a sealed tube with wet cotton for 24 hours
synthesis_conditions.result: Restoration of the original product 2 in single-crystal form, nearly identical to the structure of a newly formed crystal of 2.
All 30 of the bound and free water sites in the structure are fully deuterated.
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The structural parameters of the non-hydrogen atoms are in good agreement between the X-ray and neutron analyses.

synthesis_conditions.description: A known manganese citrate complex produced as the first step in a complex reaction procedure detailed in the Supporting Information.
Produced as the second of at least four crystalline products from the reaction mixture described in the Supporting Information.
synthesis_conditions.structure_details: The basic building block is an [Mn4(citr)4]8- cluster assembled into a polymer. There are 29 H2O units per formula unit, with 21 as aqua ligands and 9 free water sites.
